elements.name: furo-backdrop-display
elements.description:
`furo-backdrop-display`

This components receives and displays the backdrop requests from furo-backdrop components.

The backdrop display can be placed anywhere in the dom. The higher the better.

Tipp: place it below or inside the component which applies the style vars. Othewise the displayed components
do not know these vars.

```html
<!-- place the display in your main-stage -->
<furo-backdrop-display></furo-backdrop-display>
```

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: Indicates that the backdrop is shown.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
closes the backdrop.
You can close the backdrop on the display element, this is useful when you want to close the backdrops on page
changes.

Usualy the component which triggers the backdrop or is displayed closes it.

elements.name: furo-backdrop
elements.description:
`furo-backdrop`

Displays content with a backdrop.

The element you place in to furo-backdrop will be displayed centered.


```html
<furo-backdrop at-opened="--BackdropFocus" at-closed="--backdropClosed"
  fn-show="--expandIconClicked"
  fn-close="--closeRequested, --recordSelected">
     <any-component at-item-selected="--recordSelected" style="width: 90vw; height: 90vh"></any-component>
</furo-backdrop>

```

You can wire and use the elements in furo-backrop as if they were local elements.

Do not forget to add the furo-backdrop-display somewhere in the parent dom.

methods.name: show
methods.description: Initiates the backdrop and shows the content on top of the backdrop area.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Hides the display.

**Note:** The display will also get closed when the user clicks on the backdrop.

events.name: opened
events.description: The **opened** event will be fired when the content is visible on the backdrop. Tipp: you can use this to focus something on the shown content. Event.details {FuroBackdrop} is the reference to the emiting DOM node.

events.name: closed
events.description: The **closed** event will be fired when the displayed content is invisible and the backdrop is closed. Tipp: Maybe you want to use this event to refocus the initiator. Event.details {FuroBackdrop} is the reference to the emiting DOM node.

events.name: register-backdrop
events.description: Internal event to move the contents to the backdrop-display. Event.details {FuroBackdrop} is the reference to the emiting DOM node.

elements.name: furo-empty-spacer
elements.description: `furo-empty-spacer` Takes the place in furo-horizontal-flex or a furo-vertical-flex.

attributes.name: flex
attributes.description: Attribute flex for furo-horizontal-flex and furo-vertical-flex

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Set to true to hide the spacer

properties.name: flex
properties.description: Attribute flex for furo-horizontal-flex and furo-vertical-flex

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Set to true to hide the spacer

elements.name: furo-form-layouter
elements.description:
`furo-form-layouter`

Use furo-form-layouter to structure your forms.
It is based on a grid system with the following properties:
- full-width row (Standard)
- two columns
- four columns

The required variant is set using an attribute.
e.g. two, three, four and six

```html
<!-- four coulumn layout -->
<furo-form-layouter four>
   <input-element></input-element>
   <input-element double></input-element>
   <input-element newline></input-element>
   <input-element full></input-element>
</furo-form-layouter>
```


To customize the slotted elements inside furo-form-layouter there are several attributes.
- double | stretches the element over two units
- full | stretches the element to full width
- newline | forces a new line

### Responsiveness
Columns | narrow | narrower  |
----------------|-------------|-------------|
`one` | one | one |
`two` | one | one |
`three` | one | one |
`four` | two | one |
`six` | three | one |

attributes.name: narrow-fix
attributes.description:
Set narrow-fix attribute to force
the layout analog to breakpoint big

attributes.name: narrower-fix
attributes.description:
Set narrower-fix attribute to force
1 column view (analog breakpoint small)

slots.description: default slot to add content. Tags: form

properties.name: narrowFix
properties.description:
Set narrow-fix attribute to force
the layout analog to breakpoint big

properties.name: narrowerFix
properties.description:
Set narrower-fix attribute to force
1 column view (analog breakpoint small)

elements.name: furo-horizontal-flex
elements.description:
`furo-horizontal-flex` With this component, any elements can be aligned horizontally. Similar to css flex. The attribute "flex" must be set for growing elements. The component takes up 100% of the space. ```html
small
full width
small
 ```

elements.name: furo-resizer
elements.description:
`furo-resizer` container which let you resize its width. Double-click on the handler to reset the width. You need a counter part which flexes. ```html
the flexible part
```

attributes.name: lefthandle
attributes.description: add a handle to the left side

attributes.name: righthandle
attributes.description: add a handle to the right side

attributes.name: remember
attributes.description:
remember the size after resizing.
Give the id for the rememberer, you can use the id on different views

attributes.name: maxwidth
attributes.description: Set the maximal width of the resizer

attributes.name: minwidth
attributes.description: Set the minimal width of the resizer

properties.name: resetSize
properties.description: removes remember and set to the initial size

properties.name: lefthandle
properties.description: add a handle to the left side

remember the size after resizing.

elements.name: furo-split-view
elements.description:
`furo-split-view` is a layout component to visualise main / detail views (left right layout for master detail views). You can add the attribute scroll on the detail view to make the content scrollable. ```html
Master
 ```

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: flip the left and right side

slots.name: master
slots.description: default slot to add content to the main section.
default slot to add content to the detail section.

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: flip the left and right side

 ``` Tags: layout
